full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 645 Filed 03/11/22 Page 4 of 50 M38TMAX1

1 Juror 50. In post-verdict press interviews he did not reveal his last name. Consistent with that and my juror anonymity order during trial, I will permit that to continue.
2
3 I received a letter dated March 1st, 2022 from
4 Mr. Spodek. In that letter, Mr. Spodek, you informed me that
5 Juror 50 would invoke his Fifth Amendment privilege against
6 self-incrimination at this hearing. As you see from my
7 February 24 opinion, Mr. Spodek, I am going to ask Juror 50
8 questions today about responses that he gave during the jury
9 selection process in the case of United States v. Maxwell.
10
11 Does it remain your client's intention to assert his
12 Fifth Amendment privilege in response to those questions?
13 MR. SPODEK: Yes, your Honor.
14 THE COURT: I'm going to confirm on the record with
15 your client, Mr. Spodek:
16 Juror 50, is it your intention to assert your Fifth
17 Amendment privilege in response to the questions I'm going to
18 ask you today?
19 JUROR 50: Yes, your Honor.
20 THE COURT: All right. I received a written
21 application from the government last night.
22 Ms. Moe, could you confirm that the government is
23 making the application?
24 MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor.
25 THE COURT: In accord with the application, I have

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00010219
